description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment (S96a) to amend wording of condition 12 (Surface Water Drainage Scheme) of planning application ref: 178303VAR dated 16.03.2018 for 'Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary Variation of condition 2 (approved drawings) of planning application ref: P/2014/6383 dated 23.10.2015 for 'Demolition of all buildings within Sherwood Close (including 209 residential units, parking structures and ancillary buildings) and the construction of 305 new residential units (88 x one-bedroom, 157 x two-bedroom, 52 x three-bedroom and 8 x four-bedroom in a mix of housing tenures) in four apartment buildings varying between two-storeys and nine-storeys high and a row of three-storey townhouses; a 70 sq .m community space (D2 Use Class); associated energy plant room; refuse and recycling facilities; storage for 410 bicycles; 122 car parking spaces (comprising 86 spaces on-street and 36 spaces in an under croft parking area); site-wide hard and soft landscaping including public, semi-private and private amenity space and public realm improvements; the closure of part of Sherwood Close and reconfiguration of the public highway including the construction of two new north-south streets between Sherwood Close and Tawny Close, and the construction of new pedestrian / cycle routes between Sherwood Close, Tawny Close and Northfield Avenue and other associated works'./ Variation seeking to reflect Minor Material Amendments to Block C4 of the development.'
site_name: Sherwood Close Estate (Including Archer House, Crossbow House, Target House And No's 1-72)
decision_conditions: Prior to the commencement of works (excluding demolition, site clearance, and preparation works) on any phase or sub-phase (excluding Phases 1 and 2), a detailed surface water drainage scheme for each phase of the development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The scheme shall be consistent with the approved Flood Risk Assessment (Rev 005, dated February 2015) and drawing 28075-C-SK-01 Rev P2.
The surface water drainage scheme for each phase of the development (excluding Phases 1 and 2) shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details.

The Surface Water Drainage Scheme implemented for Phase 1 shall be consistent with the details in document OCSC Report - Statement for the Discharge of Planning Condition 12 Relating to Surface Water Drainage Sherwood Close - Phase 1 dated 11th March 2016.

The Surface Water Drainage Scheme implemented for Phase 2 shall be consistent with the details in document and OCSC report - Statement for the Discharge of Planning Condition 12 Relating to Surface Water Drainage Sherwood Close - Phase 2 dated March 2021.
The detailed surface water drainage scheme shall include the following information:

a) 	A clearly labelled drainage layout plan showing pipe networks and any attenuation areas or storage locations. This plan should show any pipe 'node numbers' that have been referred to in network calculations and it should also show invert and cover levels of manholes.
b) 	Confirmation of the critical storm duration.

c) 	Where infiltration forms part of the proposed stormwater system such as infiltration trenches and soakaways, soakage test results and test locations are to be submitted in accordance with BRE digest 365.
d) 	Where on site attenuation is achieved through ponds, swales, geocellular storage or other similar methods, calculations showing the volume of these are also required.
e) 	Where an outfall discharge control device is to be used such as a hydrobrake or twin orifice, this should be shown on the plan with the rate of discharge stated.

f) 	Calculations should demonstrate how the system operates during a 1 in 100 chance in any year critical duration storm event, including an allowance for climate change in line with the 'Planning Practice Guidance: Flood Risk and Coastal Change'. If overland flooding occurs in this event, a plan should also be submitted detailing the location of overland flow paths and the extent and depth of ponding.

Reason:  To minimise the risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality, improve habitat and amenity and in the interests of the drainage network in accordance with policies G6, SI 12 and SI 13 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.2(m) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.12 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
